title: Minimus 2016 #22 Pinot White (Willamette Valley)
description: A mix of five different Pinot relatives (not clones), this seems a bit overworked. It's flat in the mouth, and the mix of grapes, some white, some red, simply blends into a rather generic tasting white wine. If it resembles anything, it's a Pinot Noir Blanc, and it's already drying out, so drink up.

title: Obscured 2015 Red (California)
description: A particularly good value, this appealing and inexpensive wine adds light and tasty oak and spice accents to a good base of plummy flavors. It feels light and fresh on the palate and has enough concentration for a bit of a lingering finish.

title: P.J. Valckenberg 2016 Madonna Kabinett White (Rheinhessen)
description: Delicate hints of candied red apple and honeydew extend from nose to palate in this easy-going white blend. Off dry and soft in acidity, it's an approachable everyday sip. Drink now.

title: Parras Wines 2016 White (Lisboa)
description: The Arinto in this attractive wine gives it a floral character. Bright acidity and citrus fruits add a crisp lift and go with the hint of oak aging. This refreshing wine can be drunk now.

title: Patland 2014 Terra Del Cuore Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This is hugely tannic, nearly impenetrable wine, hard to break through, a mix of pencil lead, tobacco leaf and dried herb that presents as bittersweet and a touch green.

title: Press Run 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Dried black cherries, baked earth, rust and a hint of feral aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers an interesting line of tart red fruit along with dried thyme and a meaty touch.

title: Reyes 2014 Julia's Red (California)
description: There's a very strong scent of licorice on the nose of this blend of 54% Syrah and 46% Merlot, along with dark-red fruit and myrrh. Eucalyptus oil flavors arise on the palate, giving intrigue to the black cherry, peppercorn and roasted meat touches.

title: Ricci Curbastro NV Rosé Brut  (Franciacorta)
description: The nose is extremely shy but the tangy straightforward palate shows white cherry, Gala apple and a hint of almond. It's linear and crisp, with bright acidity a vivacious perlage.

title: Rozes 2014 Terras do Grifo Red (Douro)
description: Soft, rich and ripe, this smooth wine is full of red fruits and acidity. This fruitiness is lightly underlined by tannins and the spice from eight months in wood. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Seacampo 2015 Quinta do Vale Red (Dão)
description: A ripe, fruity blend of local Dão grapes, this unoaked wine bursts with blackberry flavors. Acidity and tannins back up the juicy fruitiness of the wine. Drink now.

title: Steam 2016 Reserve Red (Pfalz)
description: Full bodied and voluptuous, this fleshy red blend offers soft, easy black cherry and berry flavors powdered with cinnamon and cocoa. Soft, yielding tannins amplify its plush, easy style. Drink now.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Moscato (Amador County)
description: Floral and honey-like aromas lead to very sweet flavors of apricot and peach in this medium-bodied wine. A good choice for friends that only drink sweet, or with your dessert.

title: Twin Cedars 2014 Bronze Star Red (Yakima Valley)
description: This wine is 50% Cabernet Sauvignon along with 25% Cabernet Franc and 25% Malbec. Slightly elevated volatiles are followed by aromas of cherry, cinnamon, green herb, licorice and baking spice. Flavors are light and elegant in style.

title: Viña Otano 2016 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
description: Dusty aromas of white fruits are equaled by barrel-based vanilla scents. A round, easy palate gives off a powdery sense, while this barrel-fermented Viura-Tempranillo blend tastes yeasty and of green banana. Latent acidity on the finish creates mild sourness.

title: Watermill 2015 Viognier (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of watermelon Jolly Rancher, peach and flower are followed by broad honeysuckle and stone-fruit flavors. It doesn't all come together.

title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a serviceable red, built to be enjoyed now, approachable in its mix of doughy leather, black cherry and structured tannin.

title: A Mano 2016 Negroamaro (Puglia)
description: Strawberry jam and green herb aromas are joined by a delicate floral flavor on the medium-bodied palate. Bright acidity and grainy tannins lead to a crisp, dry finish.

title: Aimé Guthmann 2016 Pinot Blanc (Alsace)
description: Ripe pear notes signal a fresh, fruity wine. The palate is slightly dilute but offers crisp lemon to brighten a fairly neutral but dry palate. Drink soon.

title: Château Saint-Aubin 2015  Médoc
description: This wine treads a fine line between serious wood aging and ripe fruit. At this young stage, both characteristics are in play, giving a wine that is both full of black fruits and toasty, dry flavors. Give it time and drink from 2023.

title: Dablon 2016 Riesling (Lake Michigan Shore)
description: The nose carries aromas of ruby grapefruit alongside honeydew melon. Bright lemon-lime acidity enlivens flavors of key lime and gooseberry on the grassy palate. Hints of bitter lime creep on the finish.

title: Dalton 2016 Reserve Viognier (Galilee)
description: Aromas of clementine and juniper berry set the scene for flavors of apricot, white peach, and almond. Offering nice mouthfeel, this wine has a touch of almond blossom on the short finish.

title: Delibori 2016  Lugana
description: Aromas of honeysuckle and a whiff of tropical fruit lift from the glass while the soft round palate offers yellow peach and a confectionary note. It's simple but well made.

title: Castello Monaci 2015 Pilùna Primitivo (Salento)
description: Spiced red-berry aromas meet shades of herbs and sarsaparilla on the nose. Sandy tannins and bright acidity provide the backbone for a medium-bodied palate of tart red fruit and savory herbs.

title: Cellardoor 2013 Pinot Noir (America)
description: Raspberry and currant aromas ride over subtle tones of cedar, licorice and vanilla bean. This is a big wine, with intense oak flavors of vanilla, allspice and cedar that overpower the cranberry and raspberry fruit flavors. Plentiful grippy tannins are balanced by a backbone of acidity. The spicy tannic finish dissipates to a softer cedar note.

title: Château Beauséjour 2016  Puisseguin Saint-Émilion
description: Produced from organically grown grapes and bottled without sulfur, this wine is young, crisp and full of black fruits. Its tannins and juicy acidity suggest the wine needs to age and fill out. Wait and drink from 2020.

title: Château Fonpiqueyre 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This bright wine offers black-currant flavors and firm tannins. It is more fruit than structure, giving a generous wine that will age quickly. Drink from 2020.

title: Canneto 2013 Riserva  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Underbrush, toast and scorched earth aromas follow over to the rather lean palate along with dried cherry, a hint of prune and clove. Dusty fleeting tannins give it an abrupt finish.

title: Cantine del Borgo Reale 2013 Primitivo (Salento)
description: Red berry jam aromas meld with fresh raspberry and baking spice on the nose. The palate is light in feel, with ripe juicy berry flavors struck against a dry, chalky finish.

title: Carl Ehrhard 2016 Rüdesheim Blanc de Noirs Trocken Pinot Noir (Rheingau)
description: Dusty mineral and saline notes lend savoriness to muted red apple and raspberry in this dry blanc de noirs, a Pinot Noir vinified like a white wine. The palate is broad and soft in acidity, finishing brisk but clean. Drink now.

title: Castellani 2015 Guadalmare  (Maremma Toscana)
description: This opens with subdued aromas of baking spice and dark-skinned fruit. The simple palate offers plum, vanilla and star anise alongside smooth tannins.
